notes: weeks of opposition protests and turmoil have claimed the lives of some 170 people, while around 1,000 have been injured. rumour and speculation ran rife in local and international media this week as opposition and military leaders moved in on government and presidential buildings. the president of madagascar defied calls to quit yesterday as street protests continued and the firebrand opposition leader claimed that he was now giving orders to the army.

sources: madagascar; ravalomanana i never resigned africa news, march 31, 2009 tuesday, 1113 words, southern african development community madagascar; ravalomanana takes refuge in swaziland africa news, march 25, 2009 wednesday, 348 words, un integrated regional information networks ;
notes: the people of madagascar do not want this undemocratic regime. for over a week, people have been demonstrating against it, and asking for my return. over 30 000 people were protesting last saturday. unfortunately, violence and intimidation still prevail. after last saturday? s demonstration, a group of rebellious soldiers and some militiamen chased the people who held the peaceful demonstration in the capital, antananarivo. they shot at the demonstrators. as a result, 7 died, and more than 30 were injured. several people are missing. many were arrested. according to reports, a pre recorded message was broadcast at a pro ravalomanana demonstration in the madagascan capital, antananarivo, on 25 march, in which the former 59 year old president described his ousting as a coup .

sources: madagascar; amid political tumult, journalist s jailing draws protest africa news, may 19, 2009 tuesday, 407 words, committee to protect journalists ;
notes: in madagascar, dozens of journalists took to the streets of the capital, antananarivo, to protest the imprisonment of radio presenter evariste ramanatsoavina, held since may 4. friday s protest, which began around 10 a.m. and lasted for two hours, began in front of the communications ministry, and ended at the justice ministry, according to photojournalist kelly randriamampianina. protestors, some covering their face with gags in a show of protest, waved signs reading no to arrests of journalists, press freedom, threats against journalists: no! no! no! among others.

sources: civil unrest africa monitor southern africa, january 6, 2010 wednesday, 336 words military threat forcing steps toward reconciliation business monitor online, april 15, 2010 thursday, 773 words ;
notes: protests erupted in madagascar in mid december 2009, sparked by the breakdown in negotiations held between the country s political elite. opposition leaders and hundreds of their supporters gathered outside parliament. in response, the security forces fired teargas into the crowds, dispersing them swiftly. december 22nd 2009: security forces fire teargas at opposition leaders.

sources: government warns of opposition crackdown business monitor online, january 7, 2010 thursday, 145 words mozambique; sadc ministers prepare for au summit africa news, january 7, 2010 thursday, 427 words, agencia de informacao de mocambique maputo ;
notes: madagascar s government said it will take serious action against opposition leaders and their supporters who are rejecting election plans if they aggravate civil unrest. prime minister colonel camille vital stated that during clashes with security forces on january 6, anti government opposition protestors damaged private property and disturbed traffic in the capital of antananarivo. also on wednesday, an anti rajoelina demonstration in antananarivo came under attack from the security forces, and was dispersed with tear gas. given the need to use tear gas and the amount of people in the previous year who protested against rajoelina, this protest is coded as having at least 100 people.

sources: madagascar africa monitor southern africa, may 31, 2011 tuesday, 352 words ;
notes: a group of around 1,000 protesters demonstrated in the capital of madagascar to voice their discontent at the ruling government, which they point out was never elected. the demonstrations were dispersed using teargas, with security forces arresting seven people. according to police chief richard ravalomanana, five of those arrested had put up barricades in the middle of the street, while the other two were caught assaulting a journalist they mistook for an intelligence officer. protesters are planning more demonstrations.

sources: thousands turn out for madagascar opposition radio rally agence france presse english, may 19, 2012 saturday 5:44 pm gmt, 241 words ;
notes: malagasy police made several arrests saturday after using tear gas to break up an unauthorised protest of several thousand people who turned out to support opposition radio free fm. free fm s call for a protest drew between 3,000 and 5,000 people, according to an afp reporter. i m here because there is a dictatorship, because we no longer have freedom of speech, no right to demonstrate, one protestor who would not give his name told afp. the police then fired live bullets in the air and tear gas grenades to disperse the protest, the largest since social discontent started mounting around three weeks ago.

sources: madagascar university to resume student grants amid unrest agence france presse english, november 6, 2012 tuesday 3:40 pm gmt, 171 words ;
notes: for five months students have not been paid their monthly stipends of around eight euros 10 for first year students. eight students have been arrested since the violence began. authorities in madagascar have promised to resume paying student grants amid a violent revolt, easing tensions at the country s main campus tuesday. the students will receive one month s scholarship with a grant for equipment, while administrative and technical staff will get their unpaid salaries, antananarivo university president abel andriantsimahavandy said late monday, after a fresh day of unrest. the university, home to half the country s roughly 50,000 students, has been rocked by weeks of sometimes violent protests and staff strikes.

sources: madagascar won t expel detained ex president agence france presse english, october 18, 2014 saturday 8:55 pm gmt, 385 words malagasy authorities say not to expel ex leader bbc monitoring africa political supplied by bbc worldwide monitoring, october 19, 2014 sunday, 501 words ;
notes: earlier, madagascar police used tear gas to break up a rally by supporters of the former president, who was ousted in a coup in 2009. up to 300 people turned up for the banned protest in the capital antananarivo, throwing stones at police cars and setting fire to cardboard boxes. one man had two fingers crushed while trying to move a huge stone to block a road. he was arrested by the police and taken to hospital. the police arrested two others, including a politician who addressed the gathering. ravalomanana is effectively being held under house arrest in antsiranana diego suarez in the north of the indian ocean island, with no means of communicating with the outside world. unidentified male supporter free mr, ravalomanana now! not tomorrow! free him now! unidentified female supporter he is a citizen of madagascar and he has the right to live here! second unidentified male supporter it is not normal to isolate a former head of state. how? according to international standards, there is democracy?

sources: one killed in madagascar power cut protests agence france presse english, december 23, 2014 tuesday 8:20 am gmt, 185 words ;
notes: at least one person was killed and five injured in madagascar on monday after violent demonstrations over persistent power outages in the eastern city of toamasina. we received three injured civilians one who died from a gunshot wound and three injured policemen, said dr armand rakotoarijaona, director of the university hospital of toamasina. hundreds of people attempted to ransack the offices of madagascar s electricity and water services company jirama in protests that began friday, burning the front door and smashing the windows with rocks. toamasina, madagascar s biggest port, regularly experiences hours long power cuts, while some sections of the city go without electricity for days, badly affecting business and local traders. load shedding or rolling blackouts is a recurring problem in madagascar, where only about 15 percent of the island state is electrified. but the problem has worsened since president hery rajaonarimampianina came to power early this year. the one protester who died from a gunshot wound implies that one of the responses was shootings and another killings .

sources: one dead in madagascar protests over electricity cuts agence france presse english, january 5, 2015 monday 7:10 pm gmt, 357 words madagascar government resigns as blackouts roil country agence france presse english, january 13, 2015 tuesday 9:09 am gmt, 203 words;
notes: a protester in madagascar was killed when police put down a demonstration against recurring electricity cuts in the eastern city of toamasina, the victim s family and police said monday. the death, which happened on january 3, was the second arising from protests in the port city of toamasina over repeated power blackouts, after an aggressive police response to a violent demonstration december 23 left one person dead. according to family members of the man killed on saturday, his death was caused by a beating from special police forces deployed to contain the display of anger. madagascar police confirmed to afp that a protester who had been arrested died in hospital, but denied any beating had occurred power cuts on the island are most frequently the result of the national water and electricity company jirama paying suppliers of oil to the nation s power plants late. probably a large protest as the government resigns over it.

sources: madagascar trades unions defy ban to protest workers rights bbc monitoring africa political supplied by bbc worldwide monitoring, may 2, 2016 monday, 316 words;
notes: it was said that 1 may would be a high risk day. it did not happen. the marches organized by trade unions confederations were peaceful. but the messages chanted, were there to remind everyone of the deterioration in working conditions. for remy botuti phonetic , a worker for the government in antananarivo, the fight against impoverishment of workers begins by respecting the law.

sources: disturbances reported in several parts of madagascar s capital 24 may bbc monitoring africa political supplied by bbc worldwide monitoring, may 27, 2016 friday, 421 words;
notes: disturbances were experienced in several parts of madagascar s capital yesterday 24 may from 4a.m. local time in seven districts of antananarivo where barricades and burning tires were erected in the middle of the road. the demonstrations came a day after a speech by opposition senator rene lylison, in which he urged antananarivo residents to conduct a dead city operation to protest against the poor governance of the country. it started at 4am up to 8 am. there was tear gas and blank bullets fired. many people fled. a thousand police were therefore deployed throughout the capital. three people were arrested.

location: Public square outside city hall in Antananarivo
protesteridentity: opposition activists protesting against new election laws ahead of a vote later this year
sources: clashes at madagascar oppostion protest leave one dead, 16 injured: medic, agence france presse english, april 21, 2018 saturday 3:25 pm gmt, 428 words, antananarivo, april 21 2018; roundup: one killed, 17 injured during opposition demonstrations in madagascar, xinhua general news service, april 21, 2018 saturday 2:04 pm gmt, international news, 599 words, wenhao; top madagascar court orders formation of unity government, agence france presse english, may 25, 2018 friday 7:47 pm gmt, 537 words, antananarivo, may 25 2018
notes: one person died and 16 others were injured in clashes between madagascar s security forces and thousands of opposition activists protesting against new election laws ahead of a vote later this year in the politically volatile island nation. we received 17 wounded today, one of whom succumbed to his wounds, olivat alison aimee rakoto, head of the hospital hjra in antanannarivo, told afp. he did not specify if the injured were protesters or police. authorities had earlier in the week declared the protest illegal but opposition activists defied the order and forged ahead with the demonstration which saw thousands throng a public square outside city hall in the capital of antananarivo. clashes erupted after police fired tear gas to try to disperse the protesters as the crowd grew and overwhelmed the security forces, occupying the square, an afp reporter at the scene said. some of the opposition supporters reacted by hurling rocks at the officers. there was no immediate comment from authorities on the protests. one of the leaders the demonstration, hanitra razafimanantsoa, a parliament member supporting former president marc ravalomanana, said that four were killed, including two demonstrators shot dead and two babies suffocated by tear gas at the children hospital nearby the scene. madagascar s constitutional court on friday may 25th ordered the president to form a government of national union in a bid to end a prolonged political crisis. it issued a judgement requiring president hery rajaonarimampianina to dissolve the present government and proceed to the nomination of a consensus prime minister within seven days. madagascar has been rocked by violent protests over electoral laws that the opposition says are designed to bar their candidates from participating in elections expected this year. the court said the composition of the unity government should proportionately reflect the outcome of the last legislative elections. the new government will also be tasked with organising early elections during the 2018 dry season, a period that typically runs from may to september, it said.

protesteridentity: opposition activists demanding the resignation of the president
sources: anti government protests continue in madagascar, agence france presse english, april 28, 2018 saturday 11:22 am gmt, 342 words, antananarivo, april 28 2017; madagascar mulls early vote to end political crisis, agence france presse english, may 8, 2018 tuesday 6:07 pm gmt, 344 words, antananarivo, may 8 2018; top madagascar court orders formation of unity government, agence france presse english, may 25, 2018 friday 7:47 pm gmt, 537 words, antananarivo, may 25 2018
notes: more than 1,000 opposition activists rallied in madagascar s capital on saturday demanding the resignation of the president on the eighth straight day of anti government protests in which at least two people have died, afp reporters said. seven months ahead of presidential and legislative elections, the opposition accuses the government of trying to elbow them out of the race through new electoral laws they claim benefit the incumbent. they allege that the new laws could bar some candidates from standing in the presidential election. crowds gathered at a square in front of the capital antananarivo s town hall, calling on president hery rajaonarimampianina to quit. get lost, rajao, murderer, dangerous killer , read one banner. we should actually drop the term president from our banners, because for us rajao is no longer the president of the republic, said opposition mp, lanto rakotomanga to applause from the crowd. since april 21, hundreds of opposition supporters have occupied the may 13 square in the heart of the capital, demanding the resignation of president hery rajaonarimampianina. madagascar s constitutional court on friday may 25th ordered the president to form a government of national union in a bid to end a prolonged political crisis. it issued a judgement requiring president hery rajaonarimampianina to dissolve the present government and proceed to the nomination of a consensus prime minister within seven days. the court said the composition of the unity government should proportionately reflect the outcome of the last legislative elections. the new government will also be tasked with organising early elections during the 2018 dry season, a period that typically runs from may to september, it said.

protesteridentity: opposition supporters protesting against the president, new electoral laws, and a deadly crackdown by security forces on demonstrations
sources: madagascans return to protest after clashes, agence france presse english, april 23, 2018 monday 4:34 pm gmt, 494 words, antananarivo, april 23 2018; madagascans return to protests after clashes, agence france presse english, april 23, 2018 monday 11:04 am gmt, 449 words, antananarivo, april 23 2018; top madagascar court orders formation of unity government, agence france presse english, may 25, 2018 friday 7:47 pm gmt, 537 words, antananarivo, may 25 2018
notes: hundreds of madagascan opposition supporters returned to the streets on monday to protest against the president and a deadly crackdown by security forces on demonstrations. two people were killed and at least 16 people wounded at protests in the capital antananarivo on saturday that president hery rajaonarimampianina denounced as an attempted coup. large crowds gathered on monday to honour the victims, parading quietly pass two coffins that were placed in may 13 square, the symbolic heart of the capital antananarivo. as on sunday, security forces had banned access to the square in the city centre during the morning before withdrawing to allow the protesters to gather peacefully. to avoid violent clashes, which could cause great damage between madagascans, we chose to leave the place we had previously protected, defence minister general beni xavier rasolofonirina told reporters. but he warned the protesters that the police would never accept any state institution established outside the election process, because that is what is consistent with the constitution. the demonstrators have been protesting against new electoral laws that the opposition claim could bar some candidates from standing in upcoming presidential elections. the large indian ocean island, which has been beset by decades of political instability, is due to hold polls in late november or december. madagascar s constitutional court on friday may 25th ordered the president to form a government of national union in a bid to end a prolonged political crisis. it issued a judgement requiring president hery rajaonarimampianina to dissolve the present government and proceed to the nomination of a consensus prime minister within seven days. the court said the composition of the unity government should proportionately reflect the outcome of the last legislative elections. the new government will also be tasked with organising early elections during the 2018 dry season, a period that typically runs from may to september, it said. since april 21, hundreds of opposition supporters have occupied a key square in the heart of the capital antananarivo, demanding rajaonarimampianina resign.

location: A square in front of the capital Antananarivo s town hall
protesteridentity: opposition activists calling for the president to step down
sources: madagascar protesters seek president s resignation, agence france presse english, april 24, 2018 tuesday 2:42 pm gmt, 278 words, antananarivo, april 24 2018; top madagascar court orders formation of unity government, agence france presse english, may 25, 2018 friday 7:47 pm gmt, 537 words, antananarivo, may 25 2018
notes: hundreds of opposition activists in madagascar on tuesday called for the president to step down on a fourth straight day of anti government protests in which at least two people have died. seven months ahead of presidential and legislative elections, the opposition accuses the regime of trying to elbow them out of the race through new electoral laws they claim benefit the incumbent. they allege that the new laws could bar some candidates from standing in the presidential election. crowds gathered at a square in front of the capital antananarivo s town hall asking president hery rajaonarimampianina to quit. today we officially demand the resignation of the government, starting with you the president, hanitriniaina razafimanantsoa, a leading protester said. the crowd chanted back right now, right now, right now . madagascar s constitutional court on friday may 25th ordered the president to form a government of national union in a bid to end a prolonged political crisis. it issued a judgement requiring president hery rajaonarimampianina to dissolve the present government and proceed to the nomination of a consensus prime minister within seven days. the court said the composition of the unity government should proportionately reflect the outcome of the last legislative elections. the new government will also be tasked with organising early elections during the 2018 dry season, a period that typically runs from may to september, it said. since april 21, hundreds of opposition supporters have occupied a key square in the heart of the capital antananarivo, demanding rajaonarimampianina resign.

sources: madagascar mulls early vote to end political crisis, agence france presse english, may 8, 2018 tuesday 6:07 pm gmt, 344 words, antananarivo, may 8 2018; madagascar opposition slams govt for vetoing pm nominees, agence france presse english, june 2, 2018 saturday 5:20 pm gmt, 474 words, antananarivo, june 2 2018; new madagascar pm splits anti govt protesters, agence france presse english, june 5, 2018 tuesday 4:26 pm gmt, 329 words, antananarivo, june 5 2009
notes: madagascar s electoral commission on tuesday proposed bringing forward general elections in a bid to defuse a political crisis which has gripped the country since april. the elections had been originally scheduled for year s end. since april 21, hundreds of opposition supporters have occupied the may 13 square in the heart of the capital, demanding the resignation of president hery rajaonarimampianina. it is the resignation of hery rajaonarimampianina and his team that we want, said opposition lawmaker hanitriniaina razafimanantsoa. we will talk about elections after, the mp told supporters who have kept a daily protest vigil for nearly three weeks. madagascar s opposition condemned president hery rajaonarimampianina on saturday for rejecting their nominations for a consensus prime minister, who it is hoped will lift a crisis sparked by controversial electoral reform laws. the constitutional court has ordered president rajaonarimampianina to form a government of national unity with a consensus prime minister to avert a full blown crisis. we nominated lawmakers christine razanamahasoa, roberto tinoka and hanitriniaina razafimanantsoa to be prime minister but they were all rejected by president hery rajaonarimampianina said opposition parliamentarian arnaud tody during a well attended protest vigil in the may 13 square in the capital antananarivo. since april 21, hundreds of opposition supporters have occupied the square, initially to protest the president s proposed electoral reforms which they claimed were designed to bar their candidates from running in elections slated for this year. but after those proposals were overturned by the courts, the protests have become a full blown movement to oust rajaonarimampianina. madagascar s opposition was divided on tuesday june 5th after it emerged that a party which had been protesting against the government had recommended a new consensus prime minister to the president.

protesteridentity: opposition supporters demanding the resignation of president hery rajaonarimampianina

notes: madagascar s electoral commission on tuesday proposed bringing forward general elections in a bid to defuse a political crisis which has gripped the country since april. the elections had been originally scheduled for year s end. since april 21, hundreds of opposition supporters have occupied the may 13 square in the heart of the capital, demanding the resignation of president hery rajaonarimampianina. it is the resignation of hery rajaonarimampianina and his team that we want, said opposition lawmaker hanitriniaina razafimanantsoa. we will talk about elections after, the mp told supporters who have kept a daily protest vigil for nearly three weeks. madagascar s opposition condemned president hery rajaonarimampianina on saturday for rejecting their nominations for a consensus prime minister, who it is hoped will lift a crisis sparked by controversial electoral reform laws. the constitutional court has ordered president rajaonarimampianina to form a government of national unity with a consensus prime minister to avert a full blown crisis. we nominated lawmakers christine razanamahasoa, roberto tinoka and hanitriniaina razafimanantsoa to be prime minister but they were all rejected by president hery rajaonarimampianina said opposition parliamentarian arnaud tody during a well attended protest vigil in the may 13 square in the capital antananarivo. since april 21, hundreds of opposition supporters have occupied the square, initially to protest the president s proposed electoral reforms which they claimed were designed to bar their candidates from running in elections slated for this year. but after those proposals were overturned by the courts, the protests have become a full blown movement to oust rajaonarimampianina. madagascar s opposition was divided on tuesday june 5th after it emerged that a party which had been protesting against the government had recommended a new consensus prime minister to the president.

protesteridentity: tim party members protesting the process of nominating the new prime minister
sources: new madagascar pm splits anti govt protesters, agence france presse english, june 5, 2018 tuesday 4:26 pm gmt, 329 words, antananarivo, june 5 2018
notes: madagascar s opposition was divided on tuesday after it emerged that a party which had been protesting against the government had recommended a new consensus prime minister to the president. the indian ocean nation has been rocked by protests initially called against new electoral laws the opposition said aimed at barring their candidates from taking part in elections scheduled for later this year. but the demonstrations have turned into demands for the president to step down. opposition parties have until now set aside differences in their campaign to force out president hery rajaonarimampianina. but the tim party, led by former president marc ravalomanana, reacted angrily after opposition mapar party had suggested 57 year old technocrat christian ntsay, who is not a member of a political party, to be new prime minister. we will continue our protest even if we have a new prime minister, hanitriniaina razafimanantsoa, a tim lawmaker, told demonstrators gathered in antananarivo s central may 13 square. we are concerned by the process of nominating the new prime minister, said guy rivo randrianarisoa, another tim lawmaker present in the protest camp. note: the actual number of protesters was not included in the story, and is based on prior coding decisions

protesteridentity: opposition supporters opposed to the recycling of ministers
sources: new madagascar govt fails to end political strife, agence france presse english, june 13, 2018 wednesday 1:29 pm gmt, 576 words, antananarivo, june 13 2018
notes: after weeks of crisis and intervention by the country s top court, madagascar now has a unity government supposed to bring rivals together and steer the island nation to elections. but, among the opposition, the mood is sour and resentment still simmers. the government was unveiled on monday by president hery rajaonarimampianina and his prime minister, christian ntsay, the technocrat he appointed at the behest of the constitutional court. but many opposition supporters have reacted with disdain, dismissing the new cabinet as stuffed with old faces tainted by corruption. no recycling of ministers , screamed a large poster held by opposition protesters, who have been staging a daily vigil at the may 13 square in front of city hall. the opposition secured a dozen ministerial posts out of 30 but for their supporters, that is not enough. i m very upset that we still have hvm, said hanta razanadranaivo, 60, referring to rajaonarimampianina s party. we demanded change, and we get a recycling of former ministers . note: the actual number of protesters was not included in the story, and is based on prior coding decisions

protesteridentity: opposition supporters opposed to the recycling of ministers
